abstract: A McDonald’s spokesman said today that the company is working with union officials to help establish a union at its stores in southern Guangdong Province, one of the countries wealthiest regions.
snippet: A McDonald’s spokesman said today that the company is working with union officials to help establish a union at its stores in southern Guangdong Province, one of the countries wealthiest regions.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI, April 9 — A year after Wal-Mart unionized all its stores in China under pressure from the government, McDonald’s is cooperating with China’s large state-controlled union to allow more unions in its 670 outlets here.

headline.main: McDonald’s to Allow More Unions in Chinese Stores
headline.print_headline: McDonald’s Allows More Unions in Its Chinese Stores

abstract: Did the Wal-Mart CEO bug the board when they talked about him?
snippet: Did the Wal-Mart CEO bug the board when they talked about him?
lead_paragraph: The more we learn about Wal-Mart‘s security operation, the more it sounds scary.
